comments.commentBody: Really? You have to turn this into an attack on Hillary?

That security fee that you pay along with your airliine ticket oesn't necessarily go to the TSA. Another commenter said the revenues from those fees just go into the federal government's general fund. It's up to Congress to grant money to federal agencies such as the TSA. Blame Congress, not the underfunded federal agencies.
And remember fellow travelers, we actually PAY in addition to the cost of our airline tickets for this TSA insanity. Yes, WE pay for it each and every time we travel. Good grief.

The Republican Congress is responsible for funding as well as oversight of the TSA. There is no reason why the TSA could not function at the level of the FBI or CIA if not for the lack of will and support of the Repunlicans in Congress. Their goal is shoveling money at the rich, not providing for your security, lead free water or clean air.
Easy. The TSA budget is controlled by the Republican-held House of Representatives.

There is always someone like you to drag Israel into an unrelated discussion. Let's see - what is the cost for maintaining 28,000 American troops in Korea, or funding 25% of NATO? A lot more than Israel. The NYTimes will not print this, but they will let your uninformed nonsense slip right in.

Israel gets about $3 billion in foreign aid with Pakistan getting almost $2 billion and Egypt getting $1.6 billion.
The entire foreign aid disbursement is #50 billion.

The US is able to give $50 billion of its citizens' money to Israel but is broke when coming to fixing its infrastructure.

Go figure.

Literally all the categories you suggest here are low risk, and
Most of us have pre check. All are segments made up
Of business travelers and we're just fine. Thanks. Go buy pre check for a measly hundred dollars if you want to save some time.
Yes, that will work until the first incident takes place that can be tied to the loosened standards.

Since facts have a liberal bias:
May 19 2008 - Clinton saying the states she won are more important than the states Obama won.
http://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9502E5DC1431F937A25756C0A...

The states that I’ve won total 300 electoral votes,” she told about 300 people in a high school gymnasium in Maysville, the birthplace of the actor George Clooney. “The question is who can win 270 electoral votes? My opponent has won states totaling 217 electoral votes.”

Though I fault the TSA for never, ever acknowledging that it's at fault, so, too are the airlines. The fee for checked baggage has led directly to the idiotic overpacking of luggage compartments, tensions between passengers and cre and delayed departures and slowed arrivals. It always, always about money. I knew when they started this trusted traveler baloney that they'd try to force more people into using it by making regular lanes impossible for passengers, and that's exactly what's happened. Hand over all your personal information and pay a fee and then maybe you'll only have to spend an hour in line instead of three. This is all about greed, not about safety. And here's a thought: how about arresting the next moron who shows up with a loaded gun that he "forgot" he was carrying?
if true, tsa should be disbanded.
Wah. 30 minutes. How much did you pay for your flight?

Yep. God forbid they admit it. Israel has zero aviation related terrorist Attacks and no one misses a flight due to airport security. There's a reason: profiling. And everyone, including Arab-looking people like myself are ok with it.
Uhh, it is "that hard," if Congress doesn't give you adequate funding for staffing.

Wait til they add the next step--women claiming to be pregnant, and shuffling seats around to accommodate parents so they can sit with their kids because they neglected to book adjoining seats in the first place (though, true, sometimes the airlines have messed this us.) The number of categories is ridiculous but it's going to get worse this year.
Government employees such as TSA personnel are on fixed pay schedules and therefore there is no need for "contract talks".
The president is a Democrat and he runs the executive branch. Politicians always have money for the things that they want.

I totally agree. I worked in a media agency, the target audience or focus group studies sometimes are so full of stereotypes and sexism, even many of the briefs are actually created by women. One time, when I was working on a proposal for a branding targeting affluent families, I used a picture of females for illustration. Later my boss saw the slides and asked me to replace that picture to business men, saying pictures of men project more successful image, and my boss is a woman.
Working females, more or less, may all have experienced the pressure of discrimination, but in other cases, they could be the one who is letting it too.
And Bernie, too.  He might think he has to use a token.
Sorry, your speculation is baseless. Federal government salaries don't work that way.

Wow! I got registered into the INS-Pass program, which was the precursor to Global Entry. However, after 9/11 the INS-Pass program was put on hold and it took several years for Global Entry to emerge from its ashes. I was lucky to be already in the system, so had minimal paperwork and waiting time to get re-registered once the technology had caught up. I enter the US many times a year and Global Entry saves me a world of pain each time. Do I actually trust all those personal data in the hands of the Federal Govt? Based on the evidence, I would say no. However, it is the only solution for now to airport arrivals security gridlock. What will we do when the majority of people wise up and get Global Entry?

I've had the same thought about pre-check! I haven't paid for it, but I've been granted pre-check the last  5 or 6 times I've flown, and it's been terrific.  No lines at all to get through security.  But what will happen if all 25 million people that the TSA wants to sign up for it do?

I applied for Global Entry here in Boston and paid my $100 fee.  After passing the initial screening I was told to schedule the required personal interview.  Only when I tried to do this did I learn that the earliest available appointment is next December 23rd.  So signing up for a trusted traveler program now won't makes things better this year.  We're just going to have to stand in endless lines, like citizens of the 3rd world country the U.S. has become.

Since facts have a liberal bias:
May 22 2008 - Clinton Signals She May Carry Fight to Convention
http://www.nytimes.com/2008/05/22/us/politics/22florida.html

A day after Senator Barack Obama gathered a majority of pledged delegates in the Democratic presidential nominating contest, Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton defiantly sent out new signals Wednesday that she might take her fight for the nomination all the way to the party’s convention in August.

--- Notice here, unlike Sanders at this point who is probably but not mathematically eliminated (needs 70% of the remaining delegates to get the pledged delegate lead), Clinton was mathematically eliminated, but still threatened to go on.

The same article says: "Mr. Obama ignored Mrs. Clinton’s arguments about the delegates in an effort, his aides said, not to legitimize her point of view."

But this is not what Krugman or other Clinton surrogates are doing today - Obama didn't excoriate Clinton the way Krugman et. al. are doing with Sanders. That was the classiness of Obama. Clinton and her surrogates come up short in that area.

you don't seem to understand what a brokered convention is.

a brokered convention occurs when a nominee does not receive a majority of votes on the first ballot. that first ballot includes BOTH pledged delegates and superdelegates. in a two-person race, a brokered convention is impossible; one of them will get a majority of votes, and she will be nominee.

sanders, as a superdelegate himself, knows this, but apparently has no problem lying to his supporters in order to raise more money.

Excuse me, check your math. You compare apples to oranges. Where did you get "65% of the remaining delegates to pass Clinton in pledged delegates"?

Accepting your numbers: If HRC has 1645 pledged delegates and there are 1083 pledged delegates left, then she needs 68% of 1083 to get to 2383. (2383-1645)/1083. The corresponding number for Sanders is - he needs 98% of pledged delegates to get from 1318 to 1083. 2383-1318 = 1065 pledged delegates needed. Then 1065/1083 = 0.98

There's no brokered convention. There's just Sanders trying a riot at the convention. The super delegates will back the leader.

Clinton currently has 1,645 pledged delegates, she needs 2,383 delegates to win the nomination. There are 1083 pledged delegates left. Clinton needs to lock in 70%+ of the remaining delegates to avoid a brokered convention.

Sanders has 1,318 pledged delegates and needs to get 65% of the remaining delegates to pass Clinton in pledged delegates.

The polls I've seen show Sanders gaining roughly half the remaining delegates.

How in the world is Sanders saying the convention is likely to be brokered whining, when he's stating something that is completely factual. And his call for the superdelegates from states that heavily supported him to respect the wishes of the voters in those states, that's whining how?

-k

correction:
mountain of opposition that she would have to climb and Democrats would face.

The Sanders' agenda has always been the Democratic agenda. Why does it so often feel, while reading Bernie supporters comments, as if they popped up in 2008 then disappeared and now have reappeared without benefit of seeing what the two parties have been doing over the past eight years. The Democrats with Obama in the lead have fought very hard to rein in Wall Street and the investment banks, pass reforms to prevent another too big to fail, enacted a health care plan that makes health insurance available to all who want it regardless of health status, have fought for a massive public works project, worked to reduce income inequality, protected the LGBT community, fought against the destruction of campaign finance restrictions by the Republicans, fought against weakening the Voting Rights Act and the Civil Rights Act, ad on and on and on and on...

But where was Bernie and most of his supporters? Nowhere to be found. He didn't get out and support Democratic candidates in local elections or off year elections and neither did his supporters. He didn't lead the charge to pass all of the legislation Democrats have worked on and his supporters have been missing from the fight. The only thing he has been committed to is tearing down the one party that is actually trying to do all of the things he and his supporters say they want.

Do your homework.

Dr. K,

I want to defend your position and I am 100% with Senator Sanders on the issues & his position. As I understood your blogs from day 1, you felt that HRC was the realistic choice because of the mountain of opposition that she would have to climb Democrats would face.

In several comments I cautioned that it was not over until it was over simply because I think it is wiser for American's to feel/or be included in the process of electing a President. In my views Party primaries distort democracy & create a deceptive illusion that a person's vote counts. I am happy that the candidate selection will include the West Coast.

The primary schedule and the concept of superdelegates seem to change with the wind. I am do not believe the party registered voter requirement in some States like NY, for example, was fair.

Now to the conduct of the candidates. I am not a Sanders adviser but I think I would have advised him at the outset to avoid criticizing his opponent by name. It is far better to refer to the position of your worthy opponent and explain why that position does not fit the country's needs while giving your own position with a similar explanation. Both HRC & Senator Sanders did not follow this rule.

Senator Sanders knew that he was up against one of the most recognizable women in the World, save Queen Elizabeth and Kate Middleton. The early primaries failed in name recognition. I am pleased that the Sander's agenda has been adopted by HRC and the party.

Since facts have a liberal bias - 2008 - Clinton complaining about the process.
Readers may remember Florida and Michigan " jumped ahead in the primary calendar in January in violation of party rules. As punishment, the party stripped them of their delegates.."

May 22, 2008, http://www.nytimes.com/2008/05/22/us/politics/22florida.html

"Her swing across South Florida on Wednesday seemed essentially to be a campaign-within-a-campaign, one that is about process and is directed chiefly at the party’s rules committee.

“I’ve heard some say that counting Florida and Michigan would be changing the rules,” Mrs. Clinton said. “I say that not counting Florida and Michigan is changing a central governing rule of this country.”

She also sought to whip up populist sentiment, telling voters in Boca Raton, where the 2000 election played out vividly, “You didn’t break a single rule, and you should not be punished for matters beyond your control.”

She argued with fervor that the nomination should be determined by popular vote. She has claimed to have the lead in the popular vote by including Florida and Michigan in her tally."
Yes, please research "Medicaid Recovery" (Clawback), yet another way the plutocrats have set up to asset strip the middle class of their modest wealth.

Yes, it's about steering public funds (all those "hard earned tax dollars" we keep hearing about) into private hands. Profiting off nursing homes, private prisons, mercenaries, it's the new innovative entrepreneurship. It's like a conversation with a Republican Frankenstein creation:

"Big government...BAD. Big government contract...GOOD."
Yes it does separate people from their money, but isn't that what the Obama administration is all about?  Since day one?

Well now we know what the new growth industry is, nursing homes. First they saddle you with enormous college debt you will never pay off, then they drain your income with sky high insurance premiums and deductibles equal to two months pay. What little money you have managed to save earns 0.1% with management fees raking off the cream, then you get sick and get thrown into a nursing home until you die. The funeral home gets what's left.

It's all abut money. Life has become one gigantic feeding trough for big corporations that profit from all of this. Most all of these expenses are designed to be unavoidable. The system forcibly extracts them from us.

Make no mistake. Nursing homes are very big business run by big companies. It's racket just like privatized prisons are. The taxpayer pays for most of it and the profits go into a few hands. This is just another way to separate people from their money.
